task_text: Write a short, plain-language explanation of how time entry statuses (draft, submitted, approved, invoiced, voided) work in our system, and save it as systems/time_status_overview.md in the wiki.

text_blocks: I have Corporate Leadership access, so I can write to the wiki. Let me create a plain-language explanation of the time entry statuses and save it.

input.content:
# Time Entry Status Overview

This guide explains the different statuses a time entry can have in our system.

## Status Lifecycle

### Draft
A time entry starts as a **draft**. This means the entry has been created but is not yet finalized. You can still edit draft entries freely—change hours, dates, or notes as needed.

### Submitted
When you're confident your time entry is accurate, you **submit** it for review. Submitted entries are waiting for manager or project lead approval. Avoid making changes at this stage unless asked.

### Approved
Once a manager reviews and approves the entry, it becomes **approved**. This confirms the work was done as recorded. Approved entries are ready for billing and should not be modified.

### Invoiced
After approved time is included on a customer invoice, the entry is marked as **invoiced**. This status indicates the time has been billed. These entries are locked and cannot be changed.

### Voided
If a time entry was created in error or needs to be cancelled, it can be **voided**. Voided entries remain in the system for record-keeping but are excluded from reports and billing. To correct a voided entry, create a new entry with the correct information.

## Quick Reference

| Status | Editable? | Billable? | Purpose |
|--------|-----------|-----------|---------|
| Draft | Yes | Not yet | Work in progress |
| Submitted | Limited | Pending | Awaiting approval |
| Approved | No | Ready | Confirmed work |
| Invoiced | No | Billed | Included on invoice |
| Voided | No | No | Cancelled entry |

## Tips

- Always review your draft entries before submitting
- If you spot an error after approval, contact your project lead
- Voided entries cannot be recovered—create a new entry instead

text_blocks: The wiki article has been created successfully.

input.message:
I've created a plain-language explanation of time entry statuses and saved it to the wiki at systems/time_status_overview.md.

The article covers:
- **Draft** – Initial state, fully editable
- **Submitted** – Sent for approval, limited edits
- **Approved** – Confirmed by manager, ready for billing
- **Invoiced** – Included on customer invoice, locked
- **Voided** – Cancelled entries kept for records

It also includes a quick reference table and practical tips for employees.

summary: ok_answer: I've created a plain-language explanation of time entry statuses and saved it to the wiki at systems
